}}{{TIDTOC|adapter}} ==Overview==
{{See also|TP-LINK Archer T series|TP-LINK}}
==Links of Interest== [http://askubuntu.com/questions/499091/trying-to-install-tp-link-archer-t2u-on-ubuntu USB ID noted as 148f:761a on '''Ask Ubuntu''']
===Review of Linux Compatibility=== [http://m.linux-hardware-guide.com/2014-11-02-tp-link-archer-t2u-ac600-wifi-usb-adapter-dual-band-802-11bgnac-600mbits TP-Link Archer T2U] AC600 is a USB WiFi stick for wireless connections to 802.11ac standard. :The stick has the USB ID: 148f:761a Bus 002 Device 004: ID 148f:761a Ralink Technology, Corp. :and is based on the [[MediaTek MT7610U]] chipset. Until now there is no driver support for this chipset in the Linux kernel.
However, a Linux driver for the MT7610U chip is provided by [[MediaTek]] for the Linux kernel version 3.11 (see [http://www.mediatek.com/en/downloads/mt7610u-usb/ mediatek.com], [http://www.mediatek.com/en/downloads1/downloads/mt7610u-usb/ new link]).
[[Category:English Documentation]]
